title: How to Clean Your Microwave with Lemon and Vinegar

steps.headline: Get a microwaveable mug or bowl fill it with tap water (about halfway full).
Add lemon juice or vinegar.
steps.description: You'll want a bout 5 or 6 tablespoons if you use lemon juice and 3 tablespoons of vinegar. Fresh Lemon can also be used; you would use 1 big slice, cut in half and squeezed into the water.

steps.headline: Cook on high power for 5 minutes.
steps.description: The lemony steam works away at cooked on food and grease.

steps.headline: Keep the microwave door closed.
steps.description: Allow the bowl or mug to sit in the microwave once the cooking process has finished for an additional 4 to 5 minutes; this allows the steam to cool.

steps.headline: Remove the cup or bowl of liquid.
steps.description: Be careful; it will be hot! Do not empty the bowl or cup yet.

steps.headline: Get some paper towels or soft cloths; dish towels or dish cloths work the best.
steps.description: Wipe out the microwave. If you find you still are having a hard time cleaning off some of the food inside, you can repeat the microwaving with the same cup or bowl previously used, or dip your cloth or towel into the cup or bowl and use some of the hot Lemony or Vinegar water to wipe the food off. It should help to loosen any areas that are being stubborn. Use the hot lemon or vinegar water to clean the turntable in your microwave, the edges on the inside, the outside, your oven top and your sink...lemony fresh, no chemicals, very inexpensive, and very environmentally friendly!
